body_html:
@andrehentz
I encount the same problem when I use mobilenet ssd models. The training input tensor size is 300x300, and I want to use different input tensor size in inference, so I use the ResizeInputTensor() function:
`

std::vector<int> sizes = {1, 240, 240, 3};

interpreter_->ResizeInputTensor(interpreter_->inputs()[0], sizes);

if (interpreter_->AllocateTensors() != kTfLiteOk) {
    LOG(INFO) << "Failed to allocate tensors!" << "\n";
    return false;
}`

But I got an error in AllocateTensors():
tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/reshape.cc:58 num_input_elements != num_output_elements (2700 != 4332)
Node number 36 (RESHAPE) failed to prepare.
Failed to allocate tensors!

How to fix it? if I want to change input tensor size freely, what should I do?
